barcodes.name: UPC-A
barcodes.description: Universal Product Code (UPC) standard used in retail.

barcodes.name: EAN-13
barcodes.description: European Article Number, a superset of the original 12-digit UPC system.

barcodes.name: QR Code
barcodes.description: Two-dimensional barcode used for encoding larger amounts of data.

barcodes.name: Data Matrix
barcodes.description: Two-dimensional barcode symbology capable of encoding large amounts of data in a small area.

barcodes.name: PDF417
barcodes.description: Stacked linear barcode format used in a variety of applications.

barcodes.name: Aztec Code
barcodes.description: Two-dimensional barcode symbology designed to be read even when damaged.

barcodes.name: Codabar
barcodes.description: Discrete, self-checking symbology used in libraries and blood banks.

barcodes.name: EAN-8
barcodes.description: Short version of the EAN-13 code, suitable for small packages.

barcodes.name: ITF-14
barcodes.description: Interleaved 2 of 5 symbology used for packaging levels of products.

barcodes.name: GS1 DataBar
barcodes.description: Reduced space symbology capable of encoding additional information such as expiration dates and batch numbers.

barcodes.name: MaxiCode
barcodes.description: Two-dimensional barcode developed by UPS for high-speed scanning and tracking of packages.

barcodes.name: MSI Plessey
barcodes.description: Continuous, self-checking symbology used primarily for marking retail shelves.

barcodes.name: PostNet
barcodes.description: Barcode symbology used by the United States Postal Service to assist in directing mail.
